name: Contentful
short_desc: Contentful is an API First CMS to build digital products. It offers a GraphQL API that can be joined with Hasura using Remote Schema.

name: Strapi
short_desc: Strapi is an open-source Headless CMS

name: GraphCMS
short_desc: GraphCMS is a headless CMS allowing you to build digital experiences the way you envisioned them and connects to Hasura using Remote Schema.

name: Directus
short_desc: Directus is an open-source Headless CMS with the flexibility and power of a Data API.

name: Prismic
short_desc: Prismic is a Content Management System, a tool for editing online content

name: Open API (IBM)
short_desc: openapi-to-graphql translates APIs described by OpenAPI Specifications (OAS) or Swagger into GraphQL. Query OpenAPI/Swagger data via Hasura.

additional_resources.text: Join Open API data with Hasura

name: GraphQL Mesh
short_desc: GraphQL Mesh lets you use GraphQL to access data in remote APIs. Learn how to create a Data Graph with GraphQL Mesh & Hasura Remote Joins.

additional_resources.text: Join GraphQL Mesh data with Hasura

name: OneGraph
short_desc: OneGraph is single GraphQL endpoint that brings together all your SaaS APIs

name: Github
short_desc: Use GitHub GraphQL API to create precise and flexible queries for the data

name: GitLab
short_desc: Gitlab's GraphQL API is the primary way to interact programmatically with GitLab.

name: Shopify
short_desc: Shopify is an ecommerce platform that allows you to start and run an online shop. Integrate Shopify with your Hasura application with the help of Remote Schema

name: Adobe Commerce (Magento)
short_desc: Create engaging, shoppable experiences with Adobe Commerce

name: Sanity
short_desc: Sanity.io is the unified content platform that powers better digital experiences

name: Webiny
short_desc: Webiny is Open-Source Serverless Enterprise CMS.

name: Views: Group By & Aggregate
short_desc: Views can be used to expose the results of a custom query as a virtual table. This example demonstrates grouping by a column and aggregating.

additional_resources.text: Schema Sharing: Views - Group By & Aggregate

name: Functions: Multiple Column Text Search
short_desc: Custom functions are ideal solutions for retrieving some derived data based on some custom business logic that requires user input to be calculated. This is an example of using a custom function to create a text search across multiple columns.

additional_resources.text: Schema Sharing: Functions - Multiple Column Text Search
Documentation: Functions - Multiple Column Text Search

name: Enum: Reference Table
short_desc: Using foreign-key references to a single-column table allows us to represents an enum using ordinary relational database concepts using Hasura.

name: Relationships: One-to-One
short_desc: A one-to-one relationship between two tables can be established via a unique foreign key constraint and tracked using Hasura.

name: Relationships: One-to-Many
short_desc: A one-to-many relationship between two tables can be established via a unique foreign key constraint and tracked using Hasura.

name: Relationships: Many-to-Many
short_desc: A many-to-many relationship, established by creating a table & adding foreign-key constraints from it to the original tables, can be tracked using Hasura.

name: Permissions: Row-Level (Basic)
short_desc: Row-level permissions can be set based on a user's role or any session variables.

name: Permissions: Column-Level Filtering
short_desc: Column-level permissions determine access to columns that are accessible by the user's role.

name: Functions: Fuzzy-Match Search
short_desc: This is an example of a fuzzy-match search function across multiple columns. This schema is installable through Hasura Console.

name: Functions: PostGIS
short_desc: Fetching landmark data using the popular spacial database PostGIS extension.

name: Functions: Accessing Session Variables
short_desc: Create a function with an argument for session variables and track it using your Hasura API.

additional_resources.text: Schema Sharing: Functions - Accessing Session Variables

name: Location Tracking
short_desc: A fully-functioning location tracking model to build a realtime GraphQL API

additional_resources.text: Build a real-time location tracking app with GraphQL Subscriptions

short_desc: Transform Algolia's REST API to a GraphQL Query

short_desc: Transform Elasticsearch REST API to a GraphQL Query

short_desc: Transform Auth0 REST API to a GraphQL Query. Update profile information easily.

name: Prismic
short_desc: Transform Prismic REST API to a GraphQL Query. Search the content of your repository.
